quizTitle: Secondary 4 Chemistry: Metal Reactivity and Reactivity Series
instructions: Answer the following questions on metal reactivity with acids, water, steam, reactivity series positions, displacement reactions, and applications of reactivity data.

questions.question: Which metal reacts violently with cold water, producing an alkaline solution and hydrogen gas?
questions.explanation: Sodium reacts vigorously with cold water: 2Na + 2H₂O → 2NaOH + H₂. The solution becomes alkaline due to NaOH formation.

questions.question: Which metal does NOT react with dilute sulfuric acid?
questions.explanation: Silver is below hydrogen in the reactivity series and cannot displace hydrogen from acids.

questions.question: Which metal reacts with steam but only very slowly with cold water?
questions.explanation: Iron reacts with steam to form iron(III) oxide and hydrogen: 3Fe + 4H₂O(g) → Fe₃O₄ + 4H₂, but reacts very slowly or not at all with cold water.

questions.question: What is the correct order of reactivity (most reactive first) for these metals?
questions.explanation: From the reactivity series: Mg (most reactive of these) > Zn > Fe > Cu (least reactive).

questions.question: In a displacement reaction, zinc powder is added to copper(II) sulfate solution. What is observed?
options: Blue solution turns colourless, brown solid forms
questions.explanation: Zn + CuSO₄ → ZnSO₄ + Cu. Blue Cu²⁺ ions are replaced by colourless Zn²⁺ ions. Brown copper metal solid forms.

questions.question: A student adds copper to iron(II) sulfate solution and observes no reaction. What does this indicate?
options: Copper is less reactive than iron
The reaction is too slow to observe
Copper is more reactive than iron
questions.explanation: Copper is below iron in the reactivity series, so it cannot displace iron from its salt solution. Hence, no reaction occurs.

questions.question: Which metal can displace hydrogen from cold water but reacts only moderately?
questions.explanation: Calcium reacts with cold water moderately to produce calcium hydroxide and hydrogen gas.

questions.question: What is the meaning of a displacement reaction in terms of the reactivity series?
options: A more reactive metal displaces a less reactive metal from its compound
A less reactive metal displaces a more reactive metal
Two metals of equal reactivity exchange places
questions.explanation: Displacement occurs when a more reactive metal takes the place of a less reactive metal in a compound.

questions.question: Aluminium appears less reactive than expected because:
options: It is actually a noble metal
It forms a protective oxide layer
It does not conduct electricity well
It is below hydrogen in the series
questions.explanation: Aluminium quickly forms Al₂O₃ on its surface, which prevents further reaction, making it appear less reactive.

questions.question: In the reaction: Metal X + Copper(II) oxide → Metal X oxide + Copper. This occurs readily. What can be deduced?
options: Metal X is less reactive than copper
Metal X is more reactive than copper
questions.explanation: A metal can displace another from its oxide only if it is more reactive. So Metal X is more reactive than copper.

questions.question: Which of these metals will react with steam to give hydrogen but the reaction requires high heat?
questions.explanation: Zinc reacts with steam when strongly heated to give zinc oxide and hydrogen gas.

questions.question: What gas is produced when a reactive metal reacts with an acid?
questions.explanation: Metal + Acid → Salt + Hydrogen gas (if metal is above hydrogen in reactivity series).

questions.question: From displacement experiments, metal P displaces metal Q from nitrate solution, and metal Q displaces metal R. What is the reactivity order?
questions.explanation: If P displaces Q, then P > Q. If Q displaces R, then Q > R. So overall: P > Q > R.

questions.question: Why is potassium stored under oil?
options: To prevent reaction with oxygen and water vapour
questions.explanation: Potassium is so reactive it reacts violently with air (oxygen) and water vapour. Oil excludes these.

questions.question: Which metal could be used to displace silver from silver nitrate solution?
questions.explanation: Copper is above silver in the reactivity series, so it can displace silver: Cu + 2AgNO₃ → Cu(NO₃)₂ + 2Ag.
